page.title: 08The Coastal Area Atherfield.
page.content: The coastline extending along the southern edge of this area forms part of{the heritage coast,The Tennyson {Coast.}This year a heritage coast management project will be set up in conjunction with the county council. There will be a heritage coast officer whose task will be to improve the landscape and public access.At present a parish councillor reports the condition of footpaths etc to South Wight C.C.who are responsible for the maintenance.Rough grassland covers the unstable cliff edge which suffers frequent landslips.Underground streams undermine the already unstable layers of{sandstone and "blue-slipper"clay. This instability exposes fossils for which this area is famous.Access to the sand and shingle beach is only possible at specific points along this coast,down through{the chines.}
